properties.areaDesc: Oakland; Lapeer; Saginaw; Huron; Tuscola; Sanilac; Shiawassee; Livingston; Genesee
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 4:11AM EST until January 12 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Freezing rain producing ice accumulations around half an
inch possible. Sleet and snow may mix in at times, mainly north
of I-69, but just light accumulations if at all. Winds could
gust as high as 40 mph, which may further increase later Sunday
morning.

* WHERE...Huron, Saginaw, Tuscola, Sanilac, Shiawassee, Genesee,
Lapeer, Livingston and Oakland Counties.

* WHEN...From late Friday night through Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the
ice and strong winds. Travel could become nearly impossible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are expected to fall below
freezing early Saturday morning. There remains uncertainty where
the line of freezing temperatures and therefore freezing rain
will advance through the day Saturday, which will dictate which
areas see the highest ice accumulations. Areas that do receive
freezing rain will likely see accumulations that will lead to
treacherous travel and the potential for extended power outages.
Avoid travel Saturday if possible.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
